bill_title: provide for a criminal penalty for any person who prevents the enforcement of a secured creditor's security interest upon repossession of a motor vehicle.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a criminal penalty for any person who prevents the enforcement of a secured creditor's security interest upon repossession of a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any person who intentionally prevents the enforcement of a secured creditor's security interest in the person's motor vehicle by failing to return the motor vehicle to the secured creditor following notice of default or by prohibiting the secured creditor from taking possession of the motor vehicle is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any motor vehicle that is not returned to a secured creditor by an owner following notice of default is a stolen motor vehicle for purposes of § 32-4-1. Section 3. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any contract creating a security interest in a motor vehicle shall contain: (1) A statement that failing to return a motor vehicle subject to a security interest following receipt of any notice of default is a Class 1 misdemeanor; and (2) A statement that any notice of default will be mailed to the owner's address listed on the loan agreement and that the owner is responsible for keeping the listed address current. Section 4. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: A person shall have a defense to any charge for a violation of any provision of this Act if: (1) The person was physically incapacitated and unable to request or obtain permission of the secured creditor to retain the motor vehicle; (2) The motor vehicle itself was in a condition, through no intentional fault of the defendant, that it could not be returned to the secured creditor within the specified time; or (3) The owner has a security interest pursuant to § 57A-2-711. Section 5. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any secured creditor taking possession of a motor vehicle is responsible for any towing, storage, or any other related fees or charges if a law enforcement agency seizes the motor vehicle on behalf of the secured creditor.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a criminal penalty for any person who prevents the enforcement of a secured creditor's security interest upon repossession of a motor vehicle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any person who, following notice of default, intentionally prevents the enforcement of a secured creditor's security interest in the person's motor vehicle is guilty of a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Upon receipt of a signed and notarized affidavit stating the make, model, year, color, and VIN number of the motor vehicle, that notice has been provided to the owner, and that it has been ten days since delivery of the notice the attorney general shall list the motor vehicle as stolen pursuant to § 32-4-1. Section 3. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any contract creating a security interest in a motor vehicle shall contain: (1) A statement that intentionally preventing the repossession of a motor vehicle subject to a security interest following receipt of notice of default is a Class 1 misdemeanor; and (2) A statement that any notice of default will be mailed to the owner's address listed on the loan agreement and that the owner is responsible for keeping the listed address current with the creditor. Section 4. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: A person shall have, in addition to any other defense, the following defenses for a violation of any provision of this Act: (1) The person was physically incapacitated and unable to request or obtain permission of the secured creditor to retain the motor vehicle; (2) The motor vehicle itself was in a condition, through no intentional fault of the defendant, that it could not be returned to the secured creditor within the specified time; or (3) The owner has a security interest pursuant to § 57A-2-711. Section 5. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any secured creditor taking possession of a motor vehicle is responsible for any towing, storage, or any other related fees or charges if a law enforcement agency seizes the motor vehicle on behalf of the secured creditor. Section 6. That the code be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: For purposes of this Act, notice is a written demand to the owner for the return of a motor vehicle delivered by certified mail or served in the manner for service of process.
